• How long will the Custos battery last?
• How do I charge Custos?
• Do they come in different sizes? I have a small head.
<li><a href=""#f2"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_self"">Can you give me a brand that has comparable quality lenses? I don't understand all the technical lens specifications.  Who uses TAC &amp
How heavy are they?
• Are they suitable for active sports and not fall off my face?
• Can I comfortably fit the thicker arms on the side of my head while wearing a bicycle helmet?
• Is there a prescription lens option?
• Are the frames available in other colors, is it black glossy or matte?
The Custos campaign indicates Worldwide Shipping is available, at what cost?
• How will my Custos be shipped?
• How will I know when my Trekz Titanium™ has shipped?
• How long will shipping take?
• Can I get Custos for the Holidays?
• ""This description focuses mostly on sports, hiking, and outdoor activities. What about wearing the glasses in the city or even to work?""
• Are Custos glasses the same as Google glasses?
• This is a hi tech, latest technology version. Will there be other (upgraded) versions? If yes, when to expect them?
• Are Custos made in China?
• How can I reach out to your team directly?
What's your warranty policy?
• What's your refund policy?
I've seen other video glasses that are wifi, Custos are Bluetooth, what's the difference?

• Of course, we think the difference is HUGE. But objectively, the primary difference is Custos with Bluetooth 4.0 supports your smartphone so you can make and take phone calls, use the voice activated calling features of your phone, listen to playlists, satellite services, etc. WIFI video glasses don't have that functionality.
But with WIFI I can stream to my smartphone, that sounds pretty cool, right?

• Yes, it does and in practice it sometimes is, But (there had to be a but, right?) When you're on the slopes skiing or snowboarding or in the mountains hiking, biking, flyfishing or on that once in a lifetime trip enjoying the quiet grandeur of nature, do you have WIFI? One of the reasons we chose Bluetooth (over wifi) is we felt Bluetooth offered greater functionality.
<a name=""a3"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b> Custos are Bluetooth 4.0 and the most recent iteration is Bluetooth 4.2 is there a difference?

• While there is a difference between versions 4.0 and 4.2 the vast majority of users will not notice a difference and chances are that if you do not have the absolute latest smart phone, there is no noticeable difference.
<a name=""b1"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>I've been seeing all kinds of different pricing in campaigns, what are the hidden costs in your perks?

• There are none! Kurt here, my grandma was always saying ""The price should be the price"" and I agree, so the price is the price. There are no hidden costs in our perks. All of our perks include shipping EVERYWHERE. Does that mean we have ""jacked-up"" the price to account for the shipping? No, we have a fantastic supply chain in place and I just made the decision that we'd make a little less on the ""internationals"" due to higher shipping, and hopefully that is somewhat offset because people appreciate not being ""nickel and dimed"" or ""ala-carted"" Our Pricing Philosophy with Custos is: the price is the price
<a name=""b2"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>There are less expensive video glasses available.

• Straight cost? Yes you can buy a pair of video glasses for less. That said, when you consider the overall value of what's in our CrowdFunder package, the features and tech packed into Custos, we believe Custos offers a super premium value over what is currently available. And when you compare what you get with (whomever ""they"" are) against what is included in the Crowdfunder, we feel you'll agree Custos is a great value.
<a name=""b3"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>What exactly is included in the CrowdFunder?

• Similar and consistent with our pricing philosophy we decided to put everything we could imagine offering into the package we offer on Indiegogo. The regular retail package will only include Custos, Carrying Case, 8GB mini sd card, instructions, charging cord and cleaning cloth and have a MSRP of $249.95 and will be available with an Accessory Pack which will have the additional 5 lens colors and 32GB mini sd card and cost $49.95 for a combined MSRP of $299. For our Indiegogo supporters we stuffed it all into the CrowdFunder, which has: Custos, Protective Carrying Case, 8GB And 32 GB mini sd cards with adapters, all 6 lenses, instructions, mini USB charging cord and cleaning cloth.
<a name=""c1"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>Can I adjust the quality or resolution of the video?

<li>The great thing with Custos is you actually have the option and can move down in resolution, while a video cam with lesser resolution will find it difficult to move up in resolution.  Custos video is 1440 x 1080p and using players like Windows Media Player, Real Player etc you can render in lower resolution.
The still pictures are coming out of the Custos camera at 4480 x 3360p (15 MP) and the resolution can be easily adjusted down with a basic photo editor.
<a name=""c2"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>Can I adjust the focus, zoom?

• One of the universal limitations of video eyewear is they are fixed focus and for a number of reasons, e.g. there's not enough room to accommodate the lens, the chip set necessary, the battery power needed to name just a few. All of these would yield a design that would trend heavily away from the minimalist design we were looking for.
<a name=""c3"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>Will I be able to take video at night?

• You will need an external lighting source and then you can, though in either case the audio will be fantastic. The glasses take full advantage of, but are limited to natural and ambient lighting, i.e. they do not have their own light source
I have an iPhone, Android, windows device, are Custos compatible with my device?
<li>Custos are Bluetooth 4.0 enabled and any device that can connect with Bluetooth 4.0 is going to be compatible.

Custos are easy to ""Pair"" with your device.  The instructions have a step by step process and by the time Custos ship, the website, Custos.co will have a whole section of video tutorials including ""pairing"" Custos with your device.
It's as easy as pushing a button and listening to a voice prompt. There's even a little blue light that will help you on your way
<a name=""d2"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>What's the wireless range of Custos?
• Custos will offer reliable connectivity within a wireless range of 33 ft (10m) line of sight.
There are so many functions in Custos, but there seem to be only a few tiny buttons, can they really work to control so many different functions?
• Yes, If you can push a button, push and hold a button for 1, 3 and 5 seconds, you can operate Custos and we agree, it is almost like magic.
Is there an instruction manual with step by step how to instructions for Custos glasses?
<li>Yes, the instruction booklet is included in your CrowdFunder package.  Additionally a copy of the word doc will be available at custos.co by the time Custos ships.
Custos.co will also have video tutorials on the operation and use of Custos.
Is there a Web site where I can find detailed instructions?
• Yes, you will be able to find instructions and video tutorials—many of them actually shot with Custos—at custos.co/tutorials
Custos touts 6 different colors of interchangeable lenses, how easily are the lenses switched out and how secure are they in place?

• We are trying to upload a GIF file showing just how easy it is to switch the lenses in and out. You should be able to view it in the additional information section here. We will also post that GIF and a full tutorial on the website, custos.co/tutorials
Custos are sunglasses, don't I just need the gray and the REVO lenses?
<li>One of the very surprising things the field testers found is the versatility the additional lenses provide which makes Custos much more than just a pair of sunglasses.  We have used them:
as safety glasses doing woodworking and shooting a tutorial (Hi_Viz Yellow)
Gaming (Hi Viz Yellow, Rose and Blue lenses)
at the computer, working and shooting screen capture tutorials and videos (Rose is also the best color to mitigate eye strain associated with computer screen viewing over long periods of time)
These are just a few of the uses showcasing Custos' versatility
<a name=""e6"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>How long will the Custos battery last?
• Custos are equipped with a rechargeable lithium ion battery that delivers two (2) hours of continuous video recording and up to 4 hours play in Bluetooth (replenish charge completely in 2 hours).
<a name=""e7"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>How do I charge Custos?

• Each Custos is shipped with a standard micro-USB charging cable. You simply plug your Custos into a USB port in your computer or wall via the micro-USB charging cable and your unit will be fully charged in about two hours.
<a name=""f1"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>Do they come in different sizes? I have a small head.
• Custos come in just the one size. And while one size does not fit all, we have been amazed how the sport design accommodates a large range in sizes.
<a name=""f2"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>Can you give me a brand that has comparable quality lenses? I don't understand all the technical lens specifications.  Who uses TAC &amp

• Tri-Acetate Cellulose (TAC) and Poly-Carbonate (PC) are industry standards for scratch and shatter resistance in light-weight design and applications. Both lens materials are preferred across a wide array of manufacturers too many to list.
How heavy are they?

• The specs say 60 grams or about 2.2 oz. and because of the sport design which very evenly distributes weight between the nose pads and the side arms, Custos are comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Are they suitable for active sports and not fall off my face?
• Yes, Custos are specifically designed for sport and active use.
<a name=""f5"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>Can I comfortably fit the thicker arms on the side of my head while wearing a bicycle helmet?

• Part of the great design of Custos is that the part of the arms that come in contact with the side of your head and over your ears is flat and relatively thin and yes, they will fit nicely with a helmet.
<a name=""f6"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>Is there a prescription lens option?
<li>At the time the Custos campaign was launched there was no prescription lens option.

We are continuing talks with the manufacturer to create an adapter that could accept prescription lenses. Potentially this remains as a possibility for a ""stretch"" goal, but overall feasibility has not yet been determined.
Are the frames available in other colors, is it black glossy or matte?
• The frames are available in the matte black as shown. No additional frame colors are available at this time.
The Custos campaign indicates Worldwide Shipping is available, at what cost?

<li>As part of our pricing policy where ""The Price is the Price"" we decided to get rid of any potential confusion and include the shipping in the price, so that yes, the price is actually the price.
Custos has a great supply chain set up so shipping worldwide is included.
<a name=""g2"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>How will my Custos be shipped?

• Most likely, in the U.S. and Canada, shipping will be handled via the U.S. Postal Service. International shipments will depend on region, but Custos has distribution partners worldwide set up to accommodate all of our supporters.
<a name=""g3"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>How will I know when my Trekz Titanium™ has shipped?
• You will receive an email with a tracking number when your Custos ships.
<a name=""g4"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>How long will shipping take?

• In the U.S., Canada, once a shipping confirmation is sent, you should receive your package in 3-5 business days. International supporters can expect to receive packages within 4-7 business days. Expedited shipping is not available through our Indiegogo campaign.
Can I get Custos for the Holidays?

<li>Custos will make an outstanding gift for the Holidays.  And because we know it's always much more fun and REAL to actually have something to give and to open as a gift, we created the ""Golden Ticket"" for just this situation.

The Golden Ticket is explained here in the campaign and on the website at custos.co. We hope you agree this is a great solution that allows you to give the gift of Custos and allows us (and you) to stay within the terms and framework of the campaign on Indiegogo
""This description focuses mostly on sports, hiking, and outdoor activities. What about wearing the glasses in the city or even to work?""

<li>Absolutely yes you can!  One of the most surprising experiences to come out of our field testing were the varied uses and situations our testers used the glasses.  From family events to activities with friends, to professional sporting events to a kids ballgame, Custos provided unique POV, hands free recording.
Custos were used to record some ""cheats"" in a gaming environment, tutorials on the computer. The versatility is in large part due to the interchangeable lenses in 6 different colors.
<a name=""h2"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>Are Custos glasses the same as Google glasses?
• No, Custos are a very different product. There is no display on the lenses.
<a name=""h3"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>This is a hi tech, latest technology version. Will there be other (upgraded) versions? If yes, when to expect them?

<li>As loaded and tech packed as Custos are, there remain several areas than can be improved in future models, for example, battery life, chip set to allow for more versatility in feedback during operation and use, 4k resolution, multi-point connection in Bluetooth, noise cancellation are all future features than can be incorporated into a new version.
Many of these require more a sophisticated chip-set, which requires more miniaturization of the chip set, which is a complex, expensive and time consuming process.
<a name=""h4"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>Are Custos made in China?
<li>The short answer is yes, of course Custos are made in China.

The practical reality at this time with electronics is the Chinese manufacture ""machine"" offers a huge price advantage.  We could have Custos made here, but we'd end up importing the electronics from China.  Additionally the labor costs to assemble Custos here would be much, much higher.
In the final analysis, right now manufacture in China just makes the most business sense for a product like Custos to bring the best quality for the least expense to the market.
<a name=""h5"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>How can I reach out to your team directly?

• We love connecting with our customers, so if you'd like to reach someone on our team directly, please drop us a note. (info@custos.co) Be sure to include your phone number in your note if you'd like to speak with someone urgently.
<a name=""h6"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>What's your warranty policy?

• We offer a worry-free 30 day warranty on Custos. To submit a warranty claim, simply register your product by following the directions in the instructions included in your Custos box and contact us at warranty@custos.co and someone from the team will be in touch to help.
<a name=""h7"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><b>What's your refund policy?
• Custos provides a 30-day money back guarantee to all Indiegogo supporters. Please contact support@custos.co if you are not completely satisfied with your Custos sunglasses.
For Custos and  Safely capturing your moments from your unique perspective!
Thank you for your Support and Please help us spread the word by sharing using the social media icons on this page:  SHARE, LIKE &

","Clunky head cams?  View Blocking Devices?  Weary Arms?  All History!  Oh and no more fumbling for your devices either.  Welcome hands free, one button operation, hi-def video, super hi-resolution pics, POV eyewear.And welcome bluetooth enabled, listen to your jam, playlist, audio books, satellite service, make and take phone supported eyewear.Welcome Custos.  Cutting edge, bone conduction wearable tech with six (6) interchangeable lenses for multifunctional use.
World's safest, most technologically packed multi-functional sunglasses

CUSTOS is Latin for ""Guardian"".  Protecting you and your experience is the core concept behind Custos.  From the open ear design to the integrated EMR shielded construction to the cutting edge tech, Custos is all  about safely enhancing your experience from listening to your jam to connecting and sharing with the people in your life.
Do you ever wish you had more and better quality videos and photos of your favorite moments to share with family and friends?
Do you envy those people who seem to have everything important recorded?

You're  going to love Custos, because that can be you!  At the push of a button, your hands are free to keep doing what you were already doing and you're shooting video or taking a picture of exactly what you're looking at.  How cool is that?  And in total High Definition (HD)-Beautiful!
Maybe you ARE one of THOSE people the rest of us envy...BUT
Have you ever missed a video or great pic because you got caught up in the moment and just forgot or maybe it was too inconvenient to grab your device
Maybe you missed the moment because you were fumbling to grab your device?
Has your video or photo of a lifetime been out of the frame because you peeked around the screen trying to enjoy the moment AND record?
Has your phone or video camera ever been in the way or kept you from fully participating in or enjoying that special moment?
Spectate or Participate?  Why not BOTH.  With Custos you CAN!

You're going to love your Custos with its easy push button operation and hands free use. You won't miss anything because capturing the action is right at your fingertip and you can capture your moments totally hands free.
Be totally immersed and fully engaged from your unique perspective and never miss another memory or have your recording be out of the frame.
Record and Enjoy in  Beautiful HD!
Hands down the most robust suite of features incorporated into a pair of sunglasses EVER
In the meantime, here's what Custos Field Testers have shared...
TAC, UV-400 Polarized Lenses in Gray and REVO-Yellow Mirror
PC, UV-400 Lenses in Clear, Rose, Blue and Clear
8GB and 32GB mini SD Card, C10 speed with adapters
A few notes about the Super Lux Perks

The Lake Trout, the Bull Trout and the Golden Trout  have delivery dates in June 2016 because that's the best fishing here in Colorado.  You'll have your Custos Sunglasses delivered within the same time frame as everyone else, the trips will be delivered June or later, 2016.

You'll be fishing as Kurt's Guests at an exclusive, private catch and release club on over 100 acres, multiple  lakes, over a mile of stream.  A day includes transfers to and from fishing, all meals and flies.  You will hook fish, probably some very big trout. If you like the idea of a 20""+ trout on a dry fly this is for you!  2 days is double the fun.
Specifics on what to bring, gear, tackle, etc will be provided to the supporters buying these perks.  We promise to take very good care of you and your guest.
Lake Trout does not include any travel arrangements or accommodations, we can provide suggestions, but that cost is not included.

Bull Trout and Golden  Trout do include air and accommodations and we will make those arrangements, once made the dates will be firm, though of course we will try to accommodate all reasonable requests.
Custos Founder Interviewed by Crowd Funding Journalist/Podcaster Jonathan Nadeau
Our first press interview with Jonathan Nadeau of Crowd Funding Cast.
Jonathan has been actively covering the crowdfunding phenomenon for the past 3+ years and has been in the trenches consulting on over 100+ campaigns.
He definitely knows his crowdfunding so after he contacted me and I completed  my own due diligence I was thrilled to be able to sit down with him in skype for an interview for his podcast.
Kurt on Crowd Funding Cast (Click Here to Listen)
We currently have a working prototype and we've finalized most of the production details with our manufacturing partners.

By intention and design, at this point everything we have incorporated into Custos we are set to deliver.  That is the benefit of rigorous field testing.  We did not want customers and supporters to be guinea pigs.  There won't be any delays for features because we're marketing what we have now to deliver.  We believe that's the fair and right way to respect our supporters.
Could there be a manufacturing delay?  There is always that possibility.  Our order will go in in December and that should be great timing.
We are very confident that given your support, we'll  order on time, manufacture and produce a quality product to the exact specs we have marketed or better and deliver on time or before.

As developments occur we will keep our supporters updated via the Indiegogo system and provide timely notification of any delays.  Though it is our very sincere intention to notify our supporters we are ahead of schedule.  We like sharing good news!

But with WIFI I can stream to my smartphone, that sounds pretty cool, right?

This description focuses mostly on sports, hiking, and outdoor activities. What about wearing the glasses in the city or even to work?""
Are Custos glasses the same as Google glasses?
This is a hi tech, latest technology version. Will there be other (upgraded) versions? If yes, when to expect them?
How can I reach out to your team directly?
I've seen other video glasses that are wifi, Custos are Bluetooth, what's the difference?

Of course, we think the difference is HUGE.  But objectively, the primary difference is Custos with Bluetooth 4.0 supports your smartphone so you can make and take phone calls, use the voice activated calling features of your phone, listen to playlists, satellite services, etc.  WIFI video glasses don't have that functionality.
But with WIFI I can stream to my smartphone, that sounds pretty cool, right?

Yes, it does and in practice it sometimes is, But (there had to be a but, right?)  When you're on the slopes skiing or snowboarding or in the mountains hiking, biking, flyfishing or on that once in a lifetime trip enjoying the quiet grandeur of nature, do you have WIFI?  One of the reasons we chose Bluetooth (over wifi) is we felt Bluetooth offered greater functionality.
Custos are Bluetooth 4.0 and the most recent iteration is Bluetooth 4.2 is there a difference?

While there is a difference between versions 4.0 and 4.2 the vast majority of users will not notice a difference and chances are that if you do not have the absolute latest smart phone, there is no noticeable difference.
I've been seeing all kinds of different pricing in campaigns, what are the hidden costs in your perks?

There are none!  Kurt here, my grandma was always saying ""The price should be the price"" and I agree, so the price is the price.  There are no hidden costs in our perks.  All of our perks include shipping EVERYWHERE.  Does that mean we have ""jacked-up"" the price to account for the shipping?  No, we have a fantastic supply chain in place and I just made the decision that we'd make a little less on the ""internationals"" due to higher shipping, and hopefully that is somewhat offset because people appreciate not being ""nickel and dimed"" or ""ala-carted""  Our Pricing Philosophy with Custos is: the price is the price
There are less expensive video glasses available.

Straight cost?  Yes you can buy a pair of video glasses for less.  That said, when you consider the overall value of what's in our CrowdFunder package, the features and tech packed into Custos, we believe Custos offers a super premium value over what is currently available.  And when you compare what you get with (whomever ""they"" are) against what is included in the Crowdfunder, we feel you'll agree Custos is a great value.
What exactly is included in the CrowdFunder?

Similar and consistent with our pricing philosophy we decided to put everything we could imagine offering into the package we offer on Indiegogo.  The regular retail package will only include Custos, Carrying Case, 8GB mini sd card, instructions, charging cord and cleaning cloth and have a MSRP of $249.95 and will be available with an Accessory Pack which will have the additional 5 lens colors and 32GB mini sd card and cost $49.95 for a combined MSRP of $299.  For our Indiegogo supporters we stuffed it all into the CrowdFunder, which has:  Custos, Protective Carrying Case, 8GB And 32 GB mini sd cards with adapters, all 6 lenses, instructions, mini USB charging cord and cleaning cloth.
Can I adjust the quality or resolution of the video?

The great thing with Custos is you actually have the option and can move down in resolution, while a video cam with lesser resolution will find it difficult to move up in resolution.  Custos video is 1440 x 1080p and using players like Windows Media Player, Real Player etc you can render in lower resolution.
The still pictures are coming out of the Custos camera at 4480 x 3360p (15 MP) and the resolution can be easily adjusted down with a basic photo editor.
Can I adjust the focus, zoom?

One of the universal limitations of video eyewear is they are fixed focus and for a number of reasons, e.g. there's not enough room to accommodate the lens, the chip set necessary, the battery power needed to name just a few.  All of these would yield a design that would trend heavily away from the minimalist design we were looking for.
Will I be able to take video at night?

You will need an external lighting source and then you can, though in either case the audio will be fantastic.  The glasses take full advantage of, but are limited to natural and ambient lighting, i.e. they do not have their own light source
I have an iPhone, Android, windows device, are Custos compatible with my device?
Custos are Bluetooth 4.0 enabled and any device that can connect with Bluetooth 4.0 is going to be compatible.

Custos are easy to ""Pair"" with your device.  The instructions have a step by step process and by the time Custos ship, the website, Custos.co will have a whole section of video tutorials including ""pairing"" Custos with your device.
It's as easy as pushing a button and listening to a voice prompt.  There's even a little blue light that will help you on your way
What's the wireless range of Custos?
Custos will offer reliable connectivity within a wireless range of 33 ft (10m) line of sight.
There are so many functions in Custos, but there seem to be only a few tiny buttons, can they really work to control so many different functions?
Yes, If you can push a button, push and hold a button for 1, 3 and 5 seconds, you can operate Custos and we agree, it is almost like magic.
Is there an instruction manual with step by step how to instructions for Custos glasses?
Yes, the instruction booklet is included in your CrowdFunder package.  Additionally a copy of the word doc will be available at custos.co by the time Custos ships.
Custos.co will also have video tutorials on the operation and use of Custos.
Is there a Web site where I can find detailed instructions?
Yes, you will be able to find instructions and video tutorials—many of them actually shot with Custos—at custos.co/tutorials
Custos touts 6 different colors of interchangeable lenses, how easily are the lenses switched out and how secure are they in place?

We are trying to upload a GIF file showing just how easy it is to switch the lenses in and out.  You should be able to view it in the additional information section here.   We will also post that GIF and a full tutorial on the website, custos.co/tutorials
Custos are sunglasses, don't I just need the gray and the REVO lenses?
One of the very surprising things the field testers found is the versatility the additional lenses provide which makes Custos much more than just a pair of sunglasses.  We have used them:
as safety glasses doing woodworking and shooting a tutorial (Hi_Viz Yellow)
Gaming (Hi Viz Yellow, Rose and Blue lenses)
at the computer, working and shooting screen capture tutorials and videos (Rose is also the best color to mitigate eye strain associated with computer screen viewing over long periods of time)
These are just a few of the uses showcasing Custos' versatility
How long will the Custos battery last?
Custos are equipped with a rechargeable lithium ion battery that delivers two (2) hours of continuous video recording and up to 4 hours play in Bluetooth (replenish charge completely in 2 hours).

Each Custos is shipped with a standard micro-USB charging cable. You simply plug your Custos into a USB port in your computer or wall via the micro-USB charging cable and your unit will be fully charged in about two hours.
Do they come in different sizes? I have a small head.
Custos come in just the one size.  And while one size does not fit all, we have been amazed how the sport design accommodates a large range in sizes.
Can you give me a brand that has comparable quality lenses? I don't understand all the technical lens specifications.  Who uses TAC & PC Lenses?

Tri-Acetate Cellulose (TAC) and Poly-Carbonate (PC) are industry standards for scratch and shatter resistance in light-weight design and applications.  Both lens materials are preferred across a wide array of manufacturers too many to list.

The specs say 60 grams or about 2.2 oz. and because of the sport design which very evenly distributes weight between the nose pads and the side arms, Custos are comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Are they suitable for active sports and not fall off my face?
Yes, Custos are specifically designed for sport and active use.
Can I comfortably fit the thicker arms on the side of my head while wearing a bicycle helmet?

Part of the great design of Custos is that the part of the arms that come in contact with the side of your head and over your ears is flat and relatively thin and yes, they will fit nicely with a helmet.
Is there a prescription lens option?
At the time the Custos campaign was launched there was no prescription lens option.

We are continuing talks with the manufacturer to create an adapter that could accept prescription lenses.  Potentially this remains as a possibility for a ""stretch"" goal, but overall feasibility has not yet been determined.
Are the frames available in other colors, is it black glossy or matte?
The frames are available in the matte black as shown.  No additional frame colors are available at this time.
The Custos campaign indicates Worldwide Shipping is available, at what cost?
As part of our pricing policy where ""The Price is the Price"" we decided to get rid of any potential confusion and include the shipping in the price, so that yes, the price is actually the price.
Custos has a great supply chain set up so shipping worldwide is included.
How will my Custos be shipped?

Most likely, in the U.S. and Canada, shipping will be handled via the U.S. Postal Service. International shipments will depend on region, but Custos has distribution partners worldwide set up to accommodate all of our supporters.
How will I know when my Trekz Titanium™ has shipped?
You will receive an email with a tracking number when your Custos ships.

In the U.S., Canada, once a shipping confirmation is sent, you should receive your package in 3-5 business days. International supporters can expect to receive packages within 4-7 business days. Expedited shipping is not available through our Indiegogo campaign.
Can I get Custos for the Holidays?

Custos will make an outstanding gift for the Holidays.  And because we know it's always much more fun and REAL to actually have something to give and to open as a gift, we created the ""Golden Ticket"" for just this situation.

The Golden Ticket is explained here in the campaign and on the website at custos.co.  We hope you agree this is a great solution that allows you to give the gift of Custos and allows us (and you) to stay within the terms and framework of the campaign on Indiegogo
This description focuses mostly on sports, hiking, and outdoor activities. What about wearing the glasses in the city or even to work?""

Absolutely yes you can!  One of the most surprising experiences to come out of our field testing were the varied uses and situations our testers used the glasses.  From family events to activities with friends, to professional sporting events to a kids ballgame, Custos provided unique POV, hands free recording.
Custos were used to record some ""cheats"" in a gaming environment, tutorials on the computer.  The versatility is in large part due to the interchangeable lenses in 6 different colors.
Are Custos glasses the same as Google glasses?
No, Custos are a very different product.  There is no display on the lenses.
This is a hi tech, latest technology version. Will there be other (upgraded) versions? If yes, when to expect them?

As loaded and tech packed as Custos are, there remain several areas than can be improved in future models, for example, battery life, chip set to allow for more versatility in feedback during operation and use, 4k resolution, multi-point connection in Bluetooth, noise cancellation are all future features than can be incorporated into a new version.
Many of these require more a sophisticated chip-set, which requires more miniaturization of the chip set, which is a complex, expensive and time consuming process.
The short answer is yes, of course Custos are made in China.

The practical reality at this time with electronics is the Chinese manufacture ""machine"" offers a huge price advantage.  We could have Custos made here, but we'd end up importing the electronics from China.  Additionally the labor costs to assemble Custos here would be much, much higher.
In the final analysis, right now manufacture in China just makes the most business sense for a product like Custos to bring the best quality for the least expense to the market.
How can I reach out to your team directly?

We love connecting with our customers, so if you'd like to reach someone on our team directly, please drop us a note.  (info@custos.co)  Be sure to include your phone number in your note if you'd like to speak with someone urgently.

We offer a worry-free 30 day warranty on Custos.  To submit a warranty claim, simply register your product by following the directions in the instructions included in your Custos box and contact us at warranty@custos.co and someone from the team will be in touch to help.
Custos provides a 30-day money back guarantee to all Indiegogo supporters. Please contact support@custos.co if you are not completely satisfied with your Custos sunglasses.

What is Versust ?

Versust is a new compare based social network web site project. It can compare to your like,unlike or another things.
• You can share your Versusts with your friends or global users

• You can get detailed statistic information. You can view % like or unlike
  • You can explore What is world talking about. You can join to discussion.
• If you are undecided You can ask to World !
• Earn points. Change your position on the world rank.

column7: >The meaning of the name come from?
column16:
>Versust is coming from "" Versus "". As you know Versus is a compare adjective. But We want to create interesting and exciting name. We add ""t"" . You can imagine Versust is a versus maker. "" vs "" is a short name. We use it all website like "" VS


What is the difference from other websites?

Versust is a new social network on web. There is no any similar project publish yet. Versust offers a unique experience to users. You can find exciting topics. Your company can get real-time interaction from users. It is safe. 

What about now?

Currently, the design has been completed. Current phase of the software continues. Mobile interface design phase continues. Language translation is being worked on. Versust need to donate before opening. To develop the new language. We want to create a mobile application.


Which languages ​​will be in?

As a start we will begin broadcasting in English and Turkish. After opening We want to add some multi languages like

That's ALL!

Is that all?

Absoltly NOT !. The license is currently in progress so We  can not share all details and images.

column1: TinySticky’s transferable, no-residue nature you can use the TinySticky on almost any surface* and with a variety of objects including cell phones, coins, pencils, pens or even kitchen utensils! Use it to organize your car, office, bathroom or kitchen.

TinySticky’s special rubber is self-refreshing: when the pad becomes less sticky, washing it and letting it dry is enough to bring it back to its original state of super stickiness.

CHARACTERISTICS
• No residues or traces left on surfaces
• Attaches firmly to surfaces of all materials*
Here are the rules to get the TinySticky Go Free perk while supplies last (limited to 1 perk per user) for sharing on Facebook!

1) Select the $1 PERK called ""TinySticky Go, Facebook share"". We will thank you abundantly for donations of $1, but you will not receive a perk, we need you to share our campaign.

2) On the left hand side of the campaign page, go to the Facebook share button and share the news!

column7: >TapDock - Quintessential for the Car / Work / Home
column8:
>

THE PERFECT SOLUTION TO USE YOUR SMARTPHONE IN THE CAR / WORK / HOME

We use smartphones for most functions of our daily commute:

Navigation (Google Maps / Waze), Music (Spotify), Calls, Apps

TapDock utilizes the unused space of your in-car multimedia screen to mount your smartphone directly onto it. 

TapDock makes your drive smart again, without the hassle of fiddling with your smartphone. 

No longer spend on expensive in-car multimedia systems, just use your smartphone!
column10:
>iPhone 7 Plus mounted on Sat-Nav using TapDock
  

Smartphones evolve every year, completely outstripping the pace of car innovation. Until you buy a new generation-next car, make use of your new smartphone technologies in the simplest way possible with TapDock.

column1: Easily mount your smartphone with a simple tap
Prevents accidents by keeping the smartphone in your field of vision so you can focus on the road
Reduce clutter on your dashboard by reusing unnecessary space to mount your smartphone aesthetically
Quick and easy ""pull to detach"" method leaves no marks on your smartphone or display
Access to all your apps, exactly when you need them

column3:
>Access to all your Apps
  

SAY GOODBYE TO:

column1: • Big and ugly phone mounts on our windscreens
• Dumping your smartphone into coin/key trays causing nicks and awful scratches
• Letting go of one hand (we've seen both hands off the wheel at times) in order to use their phone
• Even if it's just to switch soundtracks or make a call, it's highly unsafe

column5:

TapDock is carefully designed with a robust 180 degree swivel mechanism, enabling numerous possibilities for everyone

Make your device truly hands-free.

Perfect for Artists and Designers to browse for inspiration while sketching/prototyping

column6:
>

We’ve tested several prototypes along the way and are finally ready with TapDock. We truly believe it’s the perfect solution to using our devices both in the car and at home/work.
column9:
Convenience engineered in a robust design
 

TapDock is manufactured with high quality materials that provide a strong absorption force. It tightly attaches to smooth and flat surfaces, especially glass and metal.
 

Grip

12 large suction cups (6 on each side) are engineered into TapDock. The suction cups are manufactured with high-end rubber that provides the ultimate double-sided grip for landscape and portrait use.

Works with and without cases.
column11:
>6 Extreme Suction Cups on each side

Swivel

TapDock is built-in with a robust 180 degree rotating swivel mechanism. The chassis is designed with 16 adjustment positions, making TapDock perfect for all viewing angles.
column14:
Reading Modes

  
We also devised a secure locking system for the 3 most used viewing positions. A metal lever, tucked into the frame of TapDock, is specifically designed to “pull &
column15: lock” for additional support for larger devices. This also improves viewing angles while driving.

We’ve accounted for some buffer into our timelines, just in case we encounter some production bottlenecks or shipping delays. Rest assured, we're working very hard to get TapDock at your doorsteps.
column46:

We love the environment and we know you do too. TapDock is manufactured sustainably in our facilities. TapDock is produced using top grade silicone and ABS plastic, both of which are non-toxic, 100% recyclable and biodegradable.

TapDock is eco-friendly in every possible way.
column49:

We really think TapDock allows us to be connected to all our apps and make our commutes truly seamless. We've put in months of hard effort, tested several prototypes, and made many improvements along the way. Our team is extremely excited and dedicated to bring TapDock to your car/office/home, but we can only do so with your support. 

We need your support to achieve our mission - to deliver an awesome product that just makes life easier.

Let's collectively make this simple product change our lives.

We were just featured in ImageUSA.  Great article to give you guys a bit more insight on what our product is.
Multicultural Tech Startup Seeks Next Step In Social Media’s Evolution From Pastime to Productivity
Posted on May 15, 2012 | Leave a comment

Continuing the trend of Millennials establishing themselves as innovators and drivers of the economy, a cause-driven tech startup aims to optimize collaboration in social media through their goal-sharing app zuggol.* IMAGES is happy to see young entrepreneurs from our community making the most of the digital age. Kudos!

True to Millennial form, Zuggol is a cause-driven startup ran by a young group of multicultural entrepreneurs in the Tech-heavy San Francisco Bay Area. Learn more about the Social Media-savvy founders here.
The Digital Age is heavily focused on collaboration and sharing, between brands and users alike
column2: sites like Facebook are built on the fundamental belief that humans are naturally social and love sharing our experiences with others. Since not every experience can be shared in person, we do our best to capture our them through photos (which has evolved to create apps like Instagram), video (YouTube) and across a number of similar platforms. Really, we’re just super-evolved versions of the cavemen who documented their experiences through wall paintings, or ancient Egyptians who used hieroglyphs.

column1: Dating back to the dawn of man (cue 2001: A Space Oddyssey-theme music), we’ve had the urge to show others where we’ve been, and we’ve gotten much better at it over the years
column2: now we also update our friends on where we are through apps like Twitter, Foursquare, or Highlight
column3: we also express who we are by showing where we’re going and what we believe, and we love collaborating with our peers through sharing knowledge/ info/ resources that can help us each toward a common goal.

column1: So which mediums truly optimize this experience by helping us along the way?

Enter zuggol, a platform based on the belief that a key to achieving goals is making them fun, having support, and sharing them with friends for motivation. Currently undergoing final testing and tweaks, the first version of the app is scheduled to hit the market for download late summer/ early fall 2012.

The platform will consist of five sectors: Education, Music, Fashion, Fitness, and Fun. Once goals are established, progress within each sector can be followed by friends, encouraging resource/information sharing to help users reach each milestone along the way. From starting a small business to training for a marathon, zuggol aims to help out and give Social Media a boost in its transition from a pastime to a truly productive endeavor. Stay tuned!

* On zuggol: Yes, the app is all lower-case (capitalize when referring to the company) and it seems hard to pronounce. You can help influence one of those concerns by voting on the app’s pronouncement here- they’ll even plant a tree for every 100 votes!

How do you use Social Media? Just for a fun pastime, as a resource for optimizing productivity, o a little bit of both? We want to hear from our readers! Comment below or Tweet us @IMAGESUSA. We will make sure to check back for an update on the success and engagement of zuggol.

Zuggol is a mobile application aimed to make goal achieving more rewarding and fun.  Sometimes achieving a goal can feel like a chore, but with this application we wish to change that.  In order for the process of achieving a goal to feel fun and more rewarding we surround people with others that share the same goals and ambitions, and together they can accomplish a goal.

Before we flat out tell you guys how much money we desire for our project, let us first start with a story.  The three founders of the company come from all over the bay area, and carry out most of their work in San Francisco, CA, a city that is full of young ,passionate, and tech savvy individuals.  The idea for the project came about in 2010 when co-founder Chris Cruz noticed it was a lot easier to stay committed to his diet when he posted pictures of himself online and received virtual admiration and approval from his peers.  From that day forward Zuggol has taken that premise and ran with it.  Now back to why we need the money.  The team here at zuggol have a clear and precise plan to launch the application by fall.  $35,000 will be used to help the team focus solely on developing Zuggol over the summer.  We plan to iron out all the kinks we have in our prototype with lines and lines and lines and lines of code that we will write over the summer to ensure we have an application that is secure and beautiful as we envision it.

This project has many valuable benefits for contributors and future users of the application.  We offer many unique rewards for contributions such as access to our beta plus 10 invites for your closest friends, to a diner and night out with the founders of Zuggol.  Although those rewards are awesome and all, the best part about any contribution that is $35 or more we will plant a tree in your honor, and that tree can forever be tracked in a virtual forest that will be set up with the help of The Carbon Farmer Inc.

If you are unable to contribute to the zuggol project there is still many ways you can help.  Just by spreading the word of our application to friends, family, and co-workers would be a huge help.  Also sign up for our e-mail list so you can get important updates on the completion of the zuggol project and if you like flash mobs also sign up for our e-mail list because we plan to have something in the near future to help promote the application =).
Check out our website for more information on the project.
Subscribe to our youtube channel : http://www.youtube.com/zuggol

Follow us on twitter @zuggolapp

","We were just featured in ImageUSA.  Great article to give you guys a bit more insight on what our product is.
Multicultural Tech Startup Seeks Next Step In Social Media’s Evolution From Pastime to Productivity
Posted on May 15, 2012 | Leave a comment

Continuing the trend of Millennials establishing themselves as innovators and drivers of the economy, a cause-driven tech startup aims to optimize collaboration in social media through their goal-sharing app zuggol.* IMAGES is happy to see young entrepreneurs from our community making the most of the digital age. Kudos!

True to Millennial form, Zuggol is a cause-driven startup ran by a young group of multicultural entrepreneurs in the Tech-heavy San Francisco Bay Area. Learn more about the Social Media-savvy founders here.
The Digital Age is heavily focused on collaboration and sharing, between brands and users alike
column2: sites like Facebook are built on the fundamental belief that humans are naturally social and love sharing our experiences with others. Since not every experience can be shared in person, we do our best to capture our them through photos (which has evolved to create apps like Instagram), video (YouTube) and across a number of similar platforms. Really, we’re just super-evolved versions of the cavemen who documented their experiences through wall paintings, or ancient Egyptians who used hieroglyphs.

column1: Dating back to the dawn of man (cue 2001: A Space Oddyssey-theme music), we’ve had the urge to show others where we’ve been, and we’ve gotten much better at it over the years
column2: now we also update our friends on where we are through apps like Twitter, Foursquare, or Highlight
column3: we also express who we are by showing where we’re going and what we believe, and we love collaborating with our peers through sharing knowledge/ info/ resources that can help us each toward a common goal.

column1: So which mediums truly optimize this experience by helping us along the way?

Enter zuggol, a platform based on the belief that a key to achieving goals is making them fun, having support, and sharing them with friends for motivation. Currently undergoing final testing and tweaks, the first version of the app is scheduled to hit the market for download late summer/ early fall 2012.

The platform will consist of five sectors: Education, Music, Fashion, Fitness, and Fun. Once goals are established, progress within each sector can be followed by friends, encouraging resource/information sharing to help users reach each milestone along the way. From starting a small business to training for a marathon, zuggol aims to help out and give Social Media a boost in its transition from a pastime to a truly productive endeavor. Stay tuned!

* On zuggol: Yes, the app is all lower-case (capitalize when referring to the company) and it seems hard to pronounce. You can help influence one of those concerns by voting on the app’s pronouncement here- they’ll even plant a tree for every 100 votes!

How do you use Social Media? Just for a fun pastime, as a resource for optimizing productivity, o a little bit of both? We want to hear from our readers! Comment below or Tweet us @IMAGESUSA. We will make sure to check back for an update on the success and engagement of zuggol.

Zuggol is a mobile application aimed to make goal achieving more rewarding and fun.  Sometimes achieving a goal can feel like a chore, but with this application we wish to change that.  In order for the process of achieving a goal to feel fun and more rewarding we surround people with others that share the same goals and ambitions, and together they can accomplish a goal.

We raised $106,072 on Kickstarter and this project became a reality! Help us continue our journey!

The MobileMount is a universal mount/kickstand for virtually any hand held device with a hard flat surface, like smartphones and tablets. Comprised of two twist-to-lock suction cups and one ball joint, this device's unique design allows for superior suction and durability. The Twist-to-Lock suction cups can hold devices for weeks at a time rather than simply a few hours like other competing mounts.  Additionally, the ""Patent Pending"" universal design allows for users to mount their a variety of devices, not just smartphones.

The two Twist-to-Lock suction cups are what make the MobileMount unique. The suction cups squeeze out the majority of the air when they are in the locked position. This creates a very strong vacuum between the suction cup and the device being mounted.  Due to the Twist-to-Lock suction cups, the MobileMount is more reliable when compared to other double suction cup mounts.

The ball and joint allow for free horizontal and vertical rotation, which allows you to angle your device according to your needs. This makes the MobileMount great for driving when you're using a GPS or hands-free calling.
The MobileMount can even be used as a kickstand with heavier devices like tablets and e-readers. The universal design lets it transform into a kickstand for any device!

Any funds raised here on indiegogo will be used for our patent application. We currently have a provisional patent, but it will be expiring soon. Thats why we need your help to apply for the full patent.  It's very expensive to apply for a full patent and we can't do it without a community like indiegogo. Thank you so much for your support!

column1: We all know early detection is critical in the fight against breast cancer. However, monthly self-breast exams have left women in doubt – “Am I doing it right? How can I really tell if this is a change from last month? When should I see my doctor?""  Our mission is to empower women with the life-saving knowledge of early detection. With the Eclipse, women no longer have to rely on only their hands and the annual mammogram.

We are creating a palm-sized home scanning device that creates a digital map of a woman’s breast with GPS-like precision. The Eclipse allows women to “see” what can’t be felt in a traditional monthly breast self-exam. Images are uploaded so changes can be monitored.  If denser masses appear vividly on a computer or tablet screen, it will prompt users to seek a comprehensive diagnosis from a medical professional.  As we all know – early detection in changes is key to saving lives.

The Eclipse device uses a 100% safe cross physics combination of sensors and low level photons (LED lights) to gather images and acquire data.  It’s as simple to use as a digital camera and uploads just as easily.  Simply move the Eclipse device over the entire area of each breast, and the images will automatically connect to make one large image of the entire breast that can be saved for reference.  The only energy used in gathering these images is a harmless low-power LED light that measures micro-pressure points onto a soft sensor pad. It’s like having your hand become a digital camera that takes a picture of the pressure point as you scan the breast.
ECLIPSE ENHANCES THE STANDARD BREAST SELF EXAM

column2: title=""Eclipse Self Exam""/>1. The Eclipse self-exam is easy and best performed while lying down. Place a pillow behind your left shoulder and arm.

title=""Eclipse Self Exam""/>2. Hold Eclipse in your right hand. Press the device at varying pressures on your left breast. Move the device in a top-to-bottom motion to ensure you scan the entire breast. Once you finish on the left side, switch the pillow to under your right shoulder and repeat the procedure on your right breast.
title=""Eclipse Self Exam""/>Option: You also can use the optional Eclipse “grid shirt” that helps guide you through a complete exam.

title=""Eclipse Self Exam""/>3. After you’ve finished scanning, transfer the images to the Eclipse software or to your Pink Cloud account.  You can do this wirelessly or by connecting the Eclipse with the supplied USB cable. The Pink Cloud is our turnkey service that stores your images on our secure website and allows them to be reviewed by medical professionals.

column1: The Eclipse combines patent-pending imaging and sensor technology into a simple and safe system that allows women to easily monitor their breast health.

The Eclipse uses no radiation or invasive technology, so women are able to use the Eclipse as often as they like without any risk of side effects. Scans are administered by applying moderate pressure while sliding the device in an overlapping pattern across the breast to produce a series of high-resolution deep-tissue images.

Images are created with TransPhotonic technology, a one hundred percent safe cross-physics combination of sensors and low-level photons that closely mimic the human touch. The sensors, however, are up to 5 times more sensitive than fingers, enabling the Eclipse to discover and capture images of small masses that could otherwise go undetected in a traditional manual self-exam. TransPhotonic technology was originally co-engineered by our founder, Ken Wright, for U.S. Navy submarines to “see” in murky-water and other obstructed situations.

Within the Eclipse software, a series of images are precisely aligned using a GPS-like function to create a complete picture of the breast. Deep tissue masses are highlighted in the image, which can then be saved and monitored for changes as part of your monthly self-breast exam, or shared with a medical professional, or the Eclipse Image Review Service.

The Pink Cloud is a networked breast health social ecosystem of Eclipse users. When a woman activates her Eclipse device, she automatically receives a Pink Cloud account. This turnkey service is as easy to use as iTunes and streamlines a woman’s ability to monitor her breast health. Images generated using the Eclipse are automatically uploaded to her personal, private account. Depending upon her preference, each woman may choose to keep her images private, share them with her doctor, use Eclipse’s review service or anonymously share them with other members of the Pink Cloud community.
Unlike traditional social media sites, the Pink Cloud is a safe, anonymous, member-only community.
The Pink Cloud brings together the combined wisdom, strength, and compassion of women who have taken control of their breast health. Once logged in, women can:

• Access a secure area to upload and store scans directly from Eclipse.  Once uploaded, they can monitor their breast health on a regular basis, share their scans with their doctor or subscribe to an image-review service in which medical experts provide analysis of their scans.
• Schedule automatic email and text reminders about self-exams.
• Provide their insights, ideas and opinions as part of a community to help us improve Eclipse and the Pink Cloud as we develop new features and services focused on early detection.
• Join our social network where they can share advice on how to better use the Eclipse, promote good breast-health practices and inspire other women to be proactive about their breast health.

Within the Pink Cloud Community, each user has an opportunity to ask and answer questions, seek and offer advice, solicit and provide counsel, and exchange referrals. In addition, the Pink Cloud hosts message boards, provides breast health information, and access to doctors.
Our aim is to make the Pink Cloud the destination site for breast health. Together, Eclipse and the Pink Cloud will become the forefront of early breast cancer detection.
Ken Wright is an accomplished inventor and visionary with a true passion for product development and industrial design.

With breast cancer awareness on the rise - and yet few innovative solutions on the horizon - Ken was inspired as a husband and father to utilize his skills as an innovator to make a better future for his wife and daughter, and generations of women ahead.

Ken has invented and contributed to award-winning product designs in industries ranging from automotive to aerospace, to telecommunications and healthcare. He also co-engineered an underwater laser scanning system for autonomous deep-sea exploration submarines which inspired Eclipse technology.

Ken also helped develop the first portable zinc-air fuel cell, the first full-motion teleconferencing system, and the first mobile satellite news vehicles. His “Edison” approach to code breaking and problem solving has made him an invaluable resource to such companies as Canon, AquaLung and NiteRider Technical Lighting Systems, LucasFilm, Paramount Pictures, Ford Motor Company and Disney.

Ken Wright: “Of all the projects I have ever worked on, Eclipse has the most meaning and value to me by far. The wonderful support we have gotten and continue to get will mean we can get this life-saving technology into women’s hands sooner than later. The Eclipse needs to exist now!”

The Eclipse team is a collaboration of intelligent and passionate technologists, scientists, doctors, breast health advocates, sponsors and associates that are determined to help ensure Eclipse becomes a reality for millions of women and loved ones.

Ken Wright, the inventor of Eclipse, was involved in developing highly advanced sensor technology that allowed autonomous submarines to see through murky water. Not only could the sensors see through these obstructed situations, they could also discriminate between different materials and molecular properties of target objects on the ocean floor.  That led to the big eureka moment when Mr. Wright realized he could modify this type of technology using harmless low level light (Photons) to look into the body, and in particular, the breast, to find specific cell targets and diseases like cancer.
Soon after his eureka moment, Ken Wright got to work. Over the next decade and a half - through countless hours of R&
column2: D, proof of concept models and prototype efforts - Ken was able to put this life saving technology into the size of a computer mouse for the price of a low cost digital camera or phone.

column1: Over 100 prototypes, proof of concept and experimental models have been iteratively developed to help us get to where we are today.

We have done extensive in-house alpha and beta testing at our Innovation Labs in San Diego, as well as collaborative testing and research with several major medical universities and cancer specialists.
We are now ready to put Eclipse into the hands of at least a thousand women to fully beta test the ergonomics and Pink Cloud experience using the Eclipse PS1 pilot program.

We are trying to break new ground and develop something that is undeniably needed: taking the guess-work out of self-breast exams with a simple and smart digital breast self-exam device. Like the now commonplace home digital scale, thermometer or blood pressure device, Eclipse delivers precise information that puts women in control of their health.

Thanks to fully functioning prototypes and extensive testing, we are ready for our first beta pilot product, Eclipse PS1, to be manufactured in a limited production. A manufacturing plant in the US has been identified, and as soon as the funding is available, production can begin. A prototype of the Pink Cloud has also been in development and tested in preparation for the beta-tester community.

Our mission is to empower women with the Eclipse digital breast self-exam system. Our goal is to put working prototypes into the hands of 1000 women by the first quarter of 2014 to gain critical feedback to have the Eclipse prepared for full production by the fourth quarter of 2014. Our goal is to have over a million Eclipses in the hands of women by the end of 2015, and more than 20 million within fiver years. We will also create and distribute over 1000 community kits to developing countries by the end of 2015, and 100,000 kits within five years.

Eclipse technology will also be made available to the medical community with the goal of radically improving current mammography systems, as well as empowering women and their doctors to work together to deliver the most comprehensive breast health.
Help us make history for women everywhere by providing an effective means of early detection that leads to early treatment in the fight against breast cancer.

This is where we need your help. The Eclipse PS1 (Phase1) system is a non-medical, beta model device. We want to put the Eclipse PS1 technology into the hands of women and medical professionals as soon as possible to gather critical feedback.
We’re looking to raise $650,000 to finish the funding needed to get the Eclipse to market.
Become Part of the Eclipse Solution Team

Make history by being the first to benefit from Eclipse! You will become part of a pilot team and learn how to use the Eclipse system and help us in the development of the final phase of Eclipse with your feedback! We want to know how you like the design, instructions, the Pink Cloud and educational components we make available. Your kit will include an Eclipse pilot system plus educational booklet and video.

The Eclipse PS-1 is a beta model/system used for evaluation and feedback from women and medical professionals It's purpose is to get our technology into the hands of 1,000 women and medical professionals for important feedback that will ultimately help our final product. This will help the company grow its user experience smartly.

Getting early adopters in at this level has a huge win-win effect for both Eclipse and the women it will help. The whole purpose is to test and develop Eclipse iteratively until it is the best it can be.

The Eclipse PS-1 program is designed to take participants through a journey of learning and discovery about breast health. It is designed for both learning and input as the process moves forward. The Eclipse experience will guide participants through:
• Interactions with the Eclipse engineering and medical professional team
• Help determine the final commercial Eclipse PS-2

NOTE: The Eclipse 1 device is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease. The FDA has not yet evaluated the Eclipse PS1 device, technology, services or statements. The Eclipse PS1 device is a pre-production model intended to be used by our pilot program participants, for the use of simulation practice, education and testing. Since the Eclipse PS1 works off of very low-level light (photons), there is no invasive or harmful technology involved. Our goal is to create a device commercially available FDA approved device that will act as a prompting tool for the user to seek professional medical attention if changes in the breast are seen and/or detected, and empower women to better monitor their breast health.

column11: title=""San Diego Business Journal""/>
column12: >Brad Graves, Bob Baransko and Korey Castillo, San Diego Business Journal

column7: >“We have interviewed and have seen many impressive technologies and innovative companies in San Diego but after visiting the Eclipse labs and seeing the Eclipse demonstration we were truly amazed. This is a technology and product path that will literally change the breast health industry. A definite game changer and life-saver.”

column8: >Dr Han Chiu M.D., MA, Stanford School of Medicine

> “I believe this is a great advancement for breast cancer and perhaps beyond to other areas of the body,” said Dr. Han Chiu MD, Stanford School of Medicine.  “It’s as safe as using your own finger tips only much more sensitive and effective.  There hasn’t been anything like this for breast health which gives me as a physician quantifiable data to be more objective while also adding to better patient interaction.”
>James H. Adair, Ph.D., Professor, Material Science and Engineering and Bioengineering, Penn State University -

column7: >“Eclipse’s vision absolutely resonates with the vision we have at Penn State and Keystone Nano.

>Eclipse and our technologies will empower women with more than just early detection, it means that the words, ""You have cancer.' will stop evoking the fear and desperation and lead to us treating cancer like just another treatable disease.  Early detection means far less invasive surgical options are possible.  Your early detection system resonates with me because we at Keystone Nano share your vision.

>We share the same enthusiastic outlook for this technology and willingness to create solutions to transform this dreaded disease into a manageable illness.  My wife, Bernadette has battled breast cancer with 11 major surgeries
>I am honored to work with the Eclipse team as part of our important mission.”

column7: >GIGAOM: Do women need a digital breast self-exam? This Indiegogo project thinks so

column1: What is the advantage of using the Eclipse over a traditional breast self-exam?
• Eclipse sensors are three- to five-times more sensitive than the human touch. This means potential issues might be detected much sooner… you’re literally “seeing” what you otherwise might not feel.
• You can save your Eclipse images to monitor changes in your breast health from month-to-month.

• Expert advice is a click away using The Pink Cloud. You’re never alone to review your Eclipse scans. You can subscribe to our review service to share your images with an expert. Or share the images to help your doctor to locate your area of concern easier.

No. The Eclipse is designed to track changes in breast tissue, which may indicate a need for follow up by your physician. Eclipse should never be considered an alternative to normal diagnostic procedures like mammograms. Eclipse serves as a “prompting tool” to seek medical attention sooner if something suspicious appears.
How can Eclipse improve my breast health?

Eclipse creates a “digital” breast self-exam by creating digital images of your deep tissue. The images highlight differences in the tissue density to indicate where a potential issue might be. The goal is to identify possible masses earlier to prompt you to seek further diagnosis by your doctor. Eclipse images also can be saved so you can monitor changes from month-to-month.
Do I need a prescription to use the Eclipse?
No. Your health care provider may recommend that you use the Eclipse, but a prescription is not necessary to purchase or use the Eclipse.
Currently, Eclipse in not covered by most insurance. Eclipse is new on the market and we’re working with insurance companies in hopes of making it eligible.
Why should I buy the first generation Eclipse rather than waiting for the FDA-approved version?

There is no better time than NOW to get a start with early detection. As a user of our first generation Eclipse model, you will have the earliest possible start at methodically monitoring your breast health! In addition, you will receive a free upgrade when the FDA-approved version is available.

Your contribution will go directly to our cause - early detection - and making Eclipse a must have for women everywhere!
